title: Are Japanese women given equal rights? - Quora

response.answer_text: As far as I know, women’s equality was written into the constitution that America developed for Japan after the war. I recall reading about on American guy during the occupation who tried to get across the idea of women’s rights by using Dagwood and Blondie comic strips. Manga strikes again! Beate Sirota Gordon - Wikipedia When the U.S. began drafting a new constitution for Japan in February, 1946, Sirota was enlisted to help, and was assigned to the subcommittee dedicated to writing the section of the constitution devoted to civil rights.
